alert.note: Alert for Clay; Platte (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 19 at 10:02PM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Wyandotte, Leavenworth, northwestern Johnson, Clinton, Clay, northwestern Ray, southwestern Caldwell and Platte Counties through 1045 PM CDT... At 1001 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Platte City, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Shawnee, Leavenworth, Liberty, Gladstone, Lansing, Excelsior Springs, Smithville, Kearney, Bonner Springs, De Soto, Parkville, Tonganoxie, Platte City, Basehor, Edwardsville, North Kansas City, Riverside, Lawson, Plattsburg and Lathrop. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 410 and 419. Interstate 35 in Missouri between mile markers 7 and 50. Interstate 29 between mile markers 0 and 26. Interstate 635 between mile markers 4 and 12. Interstate 435 between mile markers 8 and 53. Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 206 and 226. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for northwestern Missouri.
